title: The Making of the President, 1960 Audiobook Nixon Kennedy electi
description:
This is an unabridged recording of "The Making of the President, 1960" by Theodore H. White, analyzing the United States Presidential Election of 1960 between Republcan candidate Vice President Richard M. Nixon and Democratic candidate Senator John F.Kennedy.  This book was published in 1961 and won the 1962 Pulitzer Price for General Non-Fiction (the first book ever to do so).  It was critically acclaimed and remained on the best seller list for 40 weeks.  Due to its popularity, "The Making of the President" became a series, with later books covering later elections.  This audio book was produced by Books on Tape, Inc. in 1987 and was read by Grover Gardner.

This book consists of two parts and 15 chapters.  Part 1 contains Chapters 1-7, chronicling the Democratic and Republican primaries through to their respective conventions.  Part 2 contains Chapters 8-15, covering the period after the conventions on to Election Day.  This audiobook has been chaptered, so that each of the 15 mp3 files is prefixed with the number corresponding to its respective chapter.  File #1 contains the Introduction prior to the start of Chapter 1, and File #8 contains the Prolog to Part 2 before the start of Chapter 8.
